doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 58 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 169[Air Date: 11/5/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 58 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 169[Air Date: 11/5/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. The Pentagon's top doctor orders limited HTLVIII positive test result access, only civilian health officials can request2. Thomas Stoddard, Legislative Director of The New York Civil Liberties Union, worries about confidentiality of military personnel HTLVIII test results3. New York Governor Cuomo orders New York City bathhouse regulations4. Reaction to Governor Cuomo's bathhouse regulation proposal5. New York lobbyists and anti-gay AIDS bills6. National Gay Rights Advocates challenge Nevada's sodomy laws with lawsuit6. Texas Human Rights Commission raises funds to fight sodomy statutesCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp7. Senate proposes federal AIDS budget increase8. Integrity, a gay and lesbian Christian organization, plans New York City AIDS memorial9. Social security benefits proposal for ARC patients10. Meridian, Mississippi police arrest 4 impersonators at local gay bar, 1902 rule prohibits cross-dressingCOMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force11. Sports, includes clip12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Lawrence Mass discusses AIDS emergence and its spread13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Broadway Confidential, discusses Bernadette PetersCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. Sybil Bruncheon warms upCOMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action3. Sybil Bruncheon reads audience's questionsCOMMERCIAL: World of Video4. Sybil Bruncheon closes
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 58 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 169[Air Date: 11/5/1985]: November 1985
